headline: Johnson Controls Posts Strong Backlog, Confident Outlook
summary: Johnson Controls International (NYSE:JCI), the diversified global leader in smart, healthy, and sustainable buildings, saw its shares trade modestly lower on Tuesday, despite reporting a strong third quarter that surpassed analyst expectations. headline: Johnson Controls raises annual profit forecast on strong demand
summary: Johnson Controls International raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, after beating third-quarter profit estimates on the back of sustained demand for its electrical and industrial equipment. The Cork, Ireland-based firm, which makes liquid cooling systems for IT equipment as well as specialized security and fire systems, has been benefiting from the rising data center construction as businesses ramp up spending on AI technologies. Shares of the company, however, were down nearly 2% in premarket trading following the results.

headline: Saudi Arabia Home Energy Management System Market Overview and Company Analysis Report 2025-2033 Featuring Honeywell, General Electric, Comcast, Panasonic, Johnson Controls, Schneider Electric, Bosc
summary: The Saudi Arabia Home Energy Management System (HEMS) market is set to surge, anticipating growth from US$ 43.62 Million in 2024 to US$ 145.69 Million by 2033, with a CAGR of 14.34% from 2025 to 2033. This growth is fueled by energy efficiency emphasis, smart home adoption, and government incentives under Vision 2030. headline: Johnson Controls’s (NYSE:JCI) Q2 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Building operations company Johnson Controls (NYSE:JCI) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 2.6% year on year to $6.05 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $6.40 billion was less impressive, coming in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.05 per share was 3.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Johnson Controls’s (NYSE:JCI) Q2 Sales Beat Estimates

On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $6.40 billion was less impressive, coming in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.05 per share was 3.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Johnson Controls Reports Strong Q3 Results; Raises FY25 Guidance
summary: Johnson Controls International plc (NYSE: JCI), a global leader for smart, safe, healthy and sustainable buildings, today reported fiscal third quarter 2025 GAAP earnings per share ("EPS") of $0.94. Adjusted EPS was $1.05.
